Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[build] Improve a few items for new contributors" (#2075) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Update an old mention of Xamarin Studio.

Adjust capitalization in a couple links in the README so they match the
anchor names.

Add an error early in the preparation targets to let contributors know
that having spaces in the Android NDK path will lead to errors during
the build.

Fix a little typo in the order of arguments to `SymbolicLink.Create()`
in `xabuild` so that the system directories are linked into the build
output directory.  This code only runs if the directories in the build
output directory do *not exist*, so the goal is to link the system
versions of the .NETFramework and .NETPortable directories into the
build output directory.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] fix for UseLatest when API level not installed" (#2041) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Cherry-pick from (#2018)

Fixes: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/2007

Apparently there is a situation we aren't doing the right thing for:

  - `$(TargetFrameworkVersion)`=v9.0
  - `$(AndroidUseLatestPlatformSdk)`=True
  - API 28 is not installed

In this case, we *should* be downgrading `$(TargetFrameworkVersion)`
to `v8.1`.  Instead we get:

	ResolveSdksTask Outputs:
	    AndroidApiLevel: 27
	    AndroidApiLevelName: 27
	    TargetFrameworkVersion: v9.0

This puts us in a weird state, since we would use `.jar` files for
different API levels:

  - `platforms/android-27/android.jar`
  - `xbuild-frameworks/MonoAndroid/v9.0/mono.android.jar`

This in turn causes `proguard` (and likely other things) to fail:

	PROGUARD : warning : there were 38 unresolved references to classes or interfaces.
	    You may need to add missing library jars or update their versions.
	    If your code works fine without the missing classes, you can suppress
	    the warnings with '-dontwarn' options.
	    (http://proguard.sourceforge.net/manual/troubleshooting.html#unresolvedclass)

The fix here is somewhat complicated:

 1. Starting at `maxSupported` API level, check to see if:
 2. An Android API directory corresponding to `maxSupported` exists,
    e.g. `platforms/android-28`, and
 3. A `$(TargetFrameworkVersion)` directory corresponding to (2)
    exists such as `MonoAndroid/v9.0`.
 4. Decrement `maxSupported` until a value which satisfies *both*
    (2) and (3) is found.

Add a parameterized test cases verifying that the right thing is
happening when `$(AndroidUseLatestPlatformSdk)`=True and different
API levels are actually installed.

Other changes:

  - Refactored a bit to not call `int.TryParse()` when not needed. We
    could just use the `int` value and call `ToString()` in a better
    order.
  - One existing test case had an incorrect failure message; fixed.

Finally, remove `$(_SupportedApiLevel)`.  This MSBuild property
appears to be vestigial, and was causing confusion but had no real
benefit, i.e. as `$(_SupportedApiLevel)` is used to generate the
`ANDROID_X` values in `<GetAndroidDefineConstants/>`, what possible
value is there in allowing it to be *higher* than
`$(TargetFrameworkVersion)`, which controls which `Mono.Android.dll`
the source code is compiled against?

It appears that we can just remove `$(_SupportedApiLevel)`, and use
`$(_AndroidApiLevel)` in its place.  I also checked private repos,
and could find nothing that is using this property.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Application crash on startup - condition new_val < (1 << ABORT_PROT_BLOCK_BITS) not met" (#1989) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
This bug has been copied across from Bugzilla as a quick search isn't showing up any results here. The bug itself had been confirmed but hasn't been updated since October 2017.

As a quick overview, there appears to be an issue with getting passed application startup if Xamarin.Android app has a Resource.designer.cs file which is around 12MB in size. We confirmed this on Friday (7/20/2018) with one of our companies enterprise applications reaching this limit after adding new layouts. Temporarily, we have followed the advice of commenters in the original Bugzilla report to optimize the app's resources by removing unused ones and renaming some to be shorter which has given us about 2MB back but we will inevitably reach the limit again. 

Based on my native Android experience, I don't think this is a limitation of Android itself and is an issue with Mono / Xamarin

The original details from the bug can be found below. 

## condition new_val < (1 << ABORT_PROT_BLOCK_BITS) not met

_Submitted by a community member on 2017-06-09 13:56 UTC_

I just upgraded to Xamarin.Android 7.3.1.2 and my app is crashing on startup with the following error:

Assertion at /Users/builder/jenkins/workspace/xamarin-android/xamarin-android/external/mono/mono/metadata/threads.c:266, condition 'new\_val \< (1 \<\< ABORT\_PROT\_BLOCK\_BITS)' not met

This was deployed to a device running Android 7.1.1

* * *

_Reference: <https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=57320>_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "SslStream has horrible performance, high number of allocations" (#2073) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Run the Windows project on its own
2. Run the Android project with the Xamarin profiler
3. Observe the insane number of allocations performed by the SslStream on the Android side to read 100MB of data from the network

[SslStreamPerformance.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/2292030/SslStreamPerformance.zip)

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior
There should be a minimal number of allocations compared to reading from the unencrypted stream

### Actual Behavior
Over 590MB of objects are allocated to transfer 100MB of data which ends up tanking performance on Android.

### Version Information

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Members of a singleTop activity in background are finalized" (#2072) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create an activity with a singleTop launch mode and add a class member of type ObservableCollection or LruCache.
  
2. Create a second activity with a parent the first activity.
 
3. Run the app and from the first activity (which is the main activity) start the second activity.

4. Now do some resource consumption operation as loading a bitmap.

The result is JavaFinalize() is called on the member of the first activity. This is not acceptable! The instance of the first activity is still alive, but some members are disposed (Java.Lang.Object Handle becomes null). When I return back to the first activity that member is already disposed  (OnCreate is not called because of the singleTop mode).

### Expected Behavior
All members of the first activity should be alive. 

### Actual Behavior
Some of the members of the first activity are disposed.

### Version Information
Xamarin Android SDK 8.3.3.2. 

Reproduced on a real device (LG G4C) running Android API 23.

Visual Studio Community version 15.7.5.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Fixed the issue #1931" (#2071) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
HTTP headers `Server` and `User-Agent` must use space symbol as a separator instead of comma as defined in [RFC 7231](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231). Implemented this requirement similar to what have been done for NSUrlSessionHandler.cs in Xamarin.iOS.

See the issue #1931

Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
AbsoluteLayout added to a scrollview not rendered
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Try this snippet
` <ContentView>
        <StackLayout HorizontalOptions="Fill" VerticalOptions="Fill">
            <Label Text="Title"/>
            <ScrollView HorizontalOptions="Fill" VerticalOptions="FillAndExpand">
                <AbsoluteLayout HorizontalOptions="Fill" HeightRequest="150" BackgroundColor="Fuchsia"></AbsoluteLayout>
            </ScrollView>
        </StackLayout>
    </ContentView>`

### Basic Information
IDE: Visual Studio Mac
Platform Xamarin.Forms 3.1.0

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Two keyboards appear when editing the TextColumn after the NumericColumn" (#3582) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

Hi Team,

We at Syncfusion develop data visualization controls for Xamarin and we have more than 90 controls spread across all platforms of Xamarin. Please refer the below link for a description about us.
UserGuide: https://help.syncfusion.com/xamarin/sfdatagrid/overview
FeatureTour: https://www.syncfusion.com/products/xamarin

We would like to bring to your notice a bug that we encountered recently when editing the first column (Numeric column) alphanumeric Keyboard appears which is fine, after that while editing second column (Text Column), same alpha numeric keyboard appears first, next text keyboard comes to the view which is issue. 

Issue was reproduced only on Samsung Android device with Android version 6 Marshmallow , API - 23. only on Samsung keyboard 

Issue was ensured with Xamarin forms version 2.4.0.280 and latest stable version of 3.1.0.697729 too.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Run the attached sample
2. Enters in to edit mode by double tabbing
3. Edit any cell in the first column (Numeric column)
4. Then tab any where to collapse the keyboard
5.  Now edit the second column (Text column)
6. Able to see first "**Alphanumeric keyboard**" comes to the view after that "**Text keyboard**" appears, which is mentioned issue

### Expected Behavior
Only Text keyboard should appear while edit the Text column after editing of Numeric column
### Actual Behavior
After editing Numeric column if editing happens for Text column, first Alphanumeric keyboard comes to the view then Text keyboard appears.
### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 2.4.0.280
- Last known good version:  3.1.0.697729
- IDE:
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - Android: 6 Marshmallow API 23
- Nuget Packages: 3.1.0.697729
- Affected Devices:  6 Marshmallow API 23 version devices

### VideoLink

[TwoKeyboardVideo.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/2293076/TwoKeyboardVideo.zip)


### Reproduction Sample Link
[BugReport.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/2293254/BugReport.zip)

### Note: In case if SfDatagrid packages are not restored in the sample, you can download the package Syncfusion.Xamarin.SfDataGrid from nuget.org.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "DatePicker fails when binding to both minimum and maximum dates" (#3556) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
DatePicker control works fine when binding to minimum or maximum but when you bind to both it throws an exception.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a datepicker
2. Bind MinimumDate to a datetime
3. Bind Maximum Date to a datetime

### Expected Behavior
Minimum and Maximum dates are reflected in use of datepicker
### Actual Behavior
Exception is thrown
### Basic Information

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[iOS] Manifest file editor does not properly check/uncheck device interface orientations" (#3593) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

The editor and the Info.plist file show different things. Please see reproduction steps.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new project using VS2017 15.7.6
2. Right click iOS project and go to Properties -> iOS Manifest -> Click link to open the manifest editor
3. Uncheck Landscape Left (or Landscape Right)
4. Click Save All (Cntrl + Shift + S)
5. Observe that Info.plist file removes UIInterfaceOrientationLandscapeLeft (or right) but adds UIInterfaceOrientationPortraitUpsideDown (why?)

1. Create a new project using VS2017 15.7.6
2. Right click iOS project and go to Properties -> iOS Manifest -> Click link to open the manifest editor
3. Uncheck Landscape Left AND Landscape Right at the same time
4. Click Save All (Cntrl + Shift + S)
5. Observe that Info.plist file removes UIInterfaceOrientationLandscapeRight but adds UIInterfaceOrientationPortraitUpsideDown (why?) and does not remove UIInterfaceOrientationLandscapeLeft

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Dyn invoked method with too many / too large parameters throw ExecutionEngineException on device" (#4635) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
<!--
Please fill in the *entire* template below.
The template is designed to avoid unnecessary delays to confirm and fix reported issues. Issues with missing information generally end up with a `need-info` label and take significantly more time to fix. Please help us help you!
For more information see https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-&-Suggestions
For support requests use https://www.xamarin.com/support
-->
### Steps to Reproduce

1. `git clone https://github.com/taikodragon/AppBug59184`
2. Open AppBug59184.sln in Visual Studio for Mac.
4. Build and run the application in the "Debug|iPhone" configuration.

### Expected Behavior
See this bug for historic details: https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=59184
Each test should insert one row into each table.
### Actual Behavior
The first four work properly. Which demonstrates the fix the linked bug, but a mixed database object will cause the same behavior to resurface.

When trying to add a record to the fifth table (BuggedLargerNullableEntities) EFCore will cause an System.ExecutionEngineException while trying to dynamically invoke the constructor of it's Snapshot internal class.

Exception info: https://gist.github.com/taikodragon/ca8888a037bad4369e564b7c5043bcd7

### Environment

```
=== Visual Studio Professional 2017 for Mac ===

Version 7.5.4 (build 7)
Installation UUID: 0e6e8824-59be-4998-8a54-99bf6eb9fa7e
Runtime:
	Mono 5.10.1.57 (2017-12/ea8a24b1bbf) (64-bit)
	GTK+ 2.24.23 (Raleigh theme)
	Xamarin.Mac 4.4.1.193 (master / 64fece5f)

	Package version: 510010057

=== NuGet ===

Version: 4.3.1.4445

=== .NET Core ===

Runtime: /usr/local/share/dotnet/dotnet
Runtime Versions:
	2.1.1
	2.0.5
	2.0.0
SDK: /usr/local/share/dotnet/sdk/2.1.301/Sdks
SDK Versions:
	2.1.301
	2.1.4
	2.0.0
MSBuild SDKs: /Library/Frameworks/Mono.framework/Versions/5.10.1/lib/mono/msbuild/15.0/bin/Sdks

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Xcode 10 preview throwing native binding duplicate errors when trying to run on device" (#4621) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Download Xcode 10 beta from apple developer downloads
2. Install the builds from visual studio Xcode 10 preview channel(Xamarin.iOS 11.99)
3. In visual studio tools, change apple sdk path to Xcode beta
4. Try running on real device, it throws errors (Note : Simulators are working fine)

### Expected Behavior
Should compile
### Actual Behavior
Not compiling, Throwing native bindings errors

### Environment

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Mac] dynamic variable not working on release build" (#4633) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- üö® STOP üö® ùó¶ùóßùó¢ùó£ üö® ùë∫ùëªùë∂ùë∑ üö® -->

<!--
Please fill in the *entire* template below.
The template is designed to avoid unnecessary delays to confirm and fix reported issues. Issues with missing information generally end up with a `need-info` label and take significantly more time to fix. Please help us help you!
For more information see https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-&-Suggestions
For support requests use https://www.xamarin.com/support
-->
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a cocoa app.
2. Use C# and 10.10 as target macOS.
3. On the ViewDidLoad() function make a dynamic variable as string.
4. Use the dynamic variable; in my case I try to print it on Console log.

`dynamic dyn_string = "THIS IS JUST A TEST!";`
`Console.WriteLine(dyn_string);`

### Expected Behavior
It will print the "THIS IS JUST A TEST!" on the Application Output Log 
### Actual Behavior
When build is on Debug mode you get the the string, but if you switch to Release mode the Application Output Log shows this:
`
Unhandled Exception:
System.ArgumentNullException: Value cannot be null.
Parameter name: method
  at System.Linq.Expressions.Expression.Call (System.Reflection.MethodInfo method, System.Linq.Expressions.Expression arg0) [0x00045] in <9998312cb7f54d0fa102075104aa4522>:0

  at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSite1[T].MakeUpdateDelegate () [0x00151] in <9998312cb7f54d0fa102075104aa4522>:0 
  at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSite1[T].GetUpdateDelegate (T& addr) [0x0000d] in <9998312cb7f54d0fa102075104aa4522>:0 
  at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSite1[T].GetUpdateDelegate () [0x00000] in <9998312cb7f54d0fa102075104aa4522>:0 
  at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSite1[T]..ctor (System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSiteBinder binder) [0x00007] in <9998312cb7f54d0fa102075104aa4522>:0 
  at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSite1[T].Create (System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSiteBinder binder) [0x0002c] in <9998312cb7f54d0fa102075104aa4522>:0 
  at test.ViewController.ViewDidLoad () [0x00048] in <084fd0e8bccd4c81972d4c3d9736d613>:0 
  at (wrapper managed-to-native) AppKit.NSApplication.NSApplicationMain(int,string[])
  at AppKit.NSApplication.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00040] in <547ffa0ac80b49899084f906bb6a3a0b>:0 
  at test.MainClass.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00005] in <084fd0e8bccd4c81972d4c3d9736d613>:0 
[ERROR] FATAL UNHANDLED EXCEPTION: System.ArgumentNullException: Value cannot be null.
Parameter name: method
  at System.Linq.Expressions.Expression.Call (System.Reflection.MethodInfo method, System.Linq.Expressions.Expression arg0) [0x00045] in <9998312cb7f54d0fa102075104aa4522>:0 
  at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSite1[T].CreateCustomNoMatchDelegate (System.Reflection.MethodInfo invoke) [0x0003f] in <9998312cb7f54d0fa102075104aa4522>:0 
  at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSite1[T].MakeUpdateDelegate () [0x00151] in <9998312cb7f54d0fa102075104aa4522>:0 
  at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSite1[T].GetUpdateDelegate (T& addr) [0x0000d] in <9998312cb7f54d0fa102075104aa4522>:0 
  at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSite1[T].GetUpdateDelegate () [0x00000] in <9998312cb7f54d0fa102075104aa4522>:0 
  at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSite1[T]..ctor (System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSiteBinder binder) [0x00007] in <9998312cb7f54d0fa102075104aa4522>:0 
  at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSite1[T].Create (System.Runtime.CompilerServices.CallSiteBinder binder) [0x0002c] in <9998312cb7f54d0fa102075104aa4522>:0 
  at test.ViewController.ViewDidLoad () [0x00048] in <084fd0e8bccd4c81972d4c3d9736d613>:0 
  at (wrapper managed-to-native) AppKit.NSApplication.NSApplicationMain(int,string[])
  at AppKit.NSApplication.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00040] in <547ffa0ac80b49899084f906bb6a3a0b>:0 
  at test.MainClass.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00005] in <084fd0e8bccd4c81972d4c3d9736d613>:0

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[msbuild] Use xcrun everywhere to pick Apple tools" (#4634) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Following the work in https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/pull/4601 and issue https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/issues/4576.

I suggest we try to move our msbuild tasks to use `xcrun` instead of hardcoded tool path that can become obsolete.

I am thinking the `XcodeCompilerToolTask` should call `xcrun` and the all the "tool tasks" should subclass `XcodeCompilerToolTask`.
